Events & Performances
Be awed by world-class artists in our intimate 355-seat theatre, nestled in the Adirondack mountains. We‚Äôre here to bring you closer to the best performers, whether that‚Äôs music or comedy, contemporary circus or dance. Our theatre hosts the LPCA‚Äôs year-round presenting series as well as events from partners in the community like Adirondack Film, Lake Placid Sinfonietta, Lake Placid Historical Society and more!
FAQ: Events & Performances
Performances, screenings, studio classrooms and art exhibits are moving to The Annex as we begin exciting renovations to the theatre building!

The Met: Live in HD
The Met Opera returns to the LPCA screen! Join us for spectacular productions, including exciting company premieres and classic repertory favorites.
The Met Live in HD series is generously supported by our members. Consider a contribution of your own and help to bring this incredible art form to Lake Placid.
Make A Donation
Meet the Met @ LPCA

We couldn‚Äôt maintain the quality and diversity of our programming, nurture emerging artists, or provide a place of joy and learning for our community without your support. Become a member today with a gift of $50 (or more)!
Donate
Become A Member
Membership begins with 2 free tickets to an LPCA performance, 2 online class registrations or 20% a single purchase at either gallery when you donate $50 or more, and just keeps getting better from there‚Ä¶
Learn About Membership
Fundraising Events
Special events like our annual summer gala and Joy to the Children help us bring a wide variety of artistic experiences to people throughout our region and beyond, age 4 to 104.
See Upcoming Events

Make a membership contribution today and get closer to what inspires you!
DONATE TO LPCA
Help build the foundation for all that we do and enjoy deeper access to our offerings through your member benefits.
Your donation provides Annual Operating support.
We couldn‚Äôt maintain the quality and diversity of our programming, nurture emerging artists, or provide a place of joy and learning for our community without your support.
How does Membership work?
When you donate $50 or more, you automatically become a member of the LPCA. We‚Äôll email you all of the information you need to enjoy your member benefits throughout the year. (Need a hard copy? No problem. Just give us a call at (518) 523-2512 to request a paper version of your member benefits.)
View Member Benefits Chart
Member
$50‚Äî$149
Receive a 1-time Annual Gift. Choose from: 2 complimentary tickets* OR 2 free online class enrollments OR 20% off a single purchase at either LPCA gallery.
Donor Listing in the Annual Report. Learn more about LPCA programs and donors when you receive a copy of the annual report every spring.
$150‚Äî$249
All of the above and:
Early Access to Tickets for Performances. 24-hr pre-sale access to performances before they go on sale to the general public.
Save on Gallery Purchases. 10% off all purchases in Gallery 46 and Gallery @ LPCA while your membership is active.
Donor Listing in Playbill. Be recognized for your gift at every performance in our easily accessible online or print playbill.
Join LPCA Membership
Member Plus+
$250‚Äî$499
All of the above in member and:
Early Access to LPCA Education Classes. 24-hr pre-sale access to education classes before they go live to the general public, including Pottery and Tumbling.
Invitations to Special Artist Showcases. Go behind-the-scenes to see the work of artists-in-residence at private showcases not available to the general public.
$500‚Äî$999
All of the above and:
More Artists in Every Way. Receive 2 additional ticket or class vouchers and additional opportunities to meet visiting artists one-on-one.
Donor Listing in Gallery @ LPCA. Acknowledgment for your generosity in the LPCA‚Äôs most publicly accessible and visited location on campus.
$1000
All of the above and:
Concierge Ticketing. By-pass the Box Office with your own special ticketing concierge dedicated to meeting all of your ticketing needs.
$2,500
All of the above and:
Special Recognition on a Program of Your Choice. An impactful gift requires an impactful acknowledgment! Select one of LPCA‚Äôs programs to receive acknowledgment on all marketing and promotions.
Join LPCA Member Plus
Upon request, a copy of the latest annual report can be obtained from the organization or from the Office of the Attorney General, by writing or calling the Charities Bureau, 28 Liberty Street, New York, NY 10005, (212) 416-8401.
* Complimentary tickets are valid for LPCA shows only and may not apply to Partner Presentation programs.
Donate today to shape what you read, hear and see at the LPCA each year ‚Ä¶
Make a Donation

What is your refund policy?
A full refund will be granted for requests made up to 48 hours before a performance. For requests made within 48 hours before the performance, credit towards a future performance (equal to the dollar amount of the ticket purchased) will be offered.
When is the Box Office open?
The Box Office is open Thursday ‚Äì Saturday from 1-5 pm and 1.5 hours before each performance.
What time should I arrive at the theatre?
30-45 minutes before the show begins is a great time to arrive. This will give you ample time to find parking, visit Will Call, take a look through the Gallery @ LPCA, etc. before the theatre is opened for seating.
Do you have any COVID-19 policies/restrictions?
For all activities at the LPCA, masking is now optional and proof of vaccination/negative COVID test results are no longer required. This includes classes, events/performances and visits to the galleries.
We support each individual‚Äôs choice to wear a mask or not as we work to create an accepting and inclusive center for all.
Going forward, we will continue to monitor the situation so that we can respond with necessary changes to our policies if and when they‚Äôre needed.
If you have any questions about our policies or about COVID safety resources in the area, please feel free to reach out to
[email¬†protected]
or 518.523.2512.
What if I lost or can‚Äôt print my emailed ticket?
No need to print your ticket; we can scan tickets right on your phone. If you lost the email with your ticket, visit our Box Office for assistance.
What qualifies as a Youth or Student ticket?
Youth or Student ticket prices are for age 18 and younger, unless otherwise indicated. (E.g., sometimes Youth tickets might be designated as 12 and under.)
How big is the LPCA Theatre?
The LPCA Theatre seats 355 people. View the
seating chart here
.
Do you serve concessions?
Yes, we typically have wine, beer, soft drinks and select snacks available for purchase before a performance and during intermission if there is one. (Popcorn is served only for film screenings.)
Occasionally concessions are closed upon the request of the performer, so we always encourage you to check with the Box Office (518.523.2512) if you have any questions before the show!
Do you offer group ticketing rates?
Depending on the show, we may be able to offer special rates for groups of 8 or more. Please contact our Box Office at 518.523.2512 if you would like to make arrangements for a group!
Why is there a ticketing fee?
The ticketing fee helps us to cover the cost of processing ticket sales online. We realize how frustrating it can be when your tickets cost more than you expected, so we work to avoid multiple transaction fees that you may have encountered buying tickets for events at larger venues.
Do you have assisted hearing devices?
A personal hearing assistance system is available in the theatre. To use this service, please speak with a Box Office representative when you arrive for a performance to pick up a device.
How can I tell if an event is live or shown on the movie screen?
Visit the event page for the show you‚Äôre interested in to see if it is tagged as ‚ÄúFilm‚Äù or a ‚ÄúLive Event.‚Äù If you‚Äôre still not sure, our Box Office staff are available to help clarify details ‚Äì 518.523.2512 or
[email¬†protected]
.
What does ‚ÄúLPCA Partner Presentation‚Äù mean?
An ‚ÄúLPCA Partner Presentation‚Äù is an event that has been produced or curated by another organization outside the LPCA. The LPCA is glad to collaborate with organizations like the Lake Placid Sinfonietta, Adirondack Film and others to provide the theatre space and staffing that other groups need to present their own artistic content!
Stay updated with events, classes & special offers.
Join our email list and learn about everything there is to do at the LPCA!

The Met Live in HD series is generously supported by our members. Consider a contribution of your own and help to bring this incredible art form to Lake Placid.

Meet the Met @ LPCA

Joy to the Children
Generously donated by the
Mirror Lake Inn Resort and Spa
and the Weibrecht Family, Joy to the Children is the unofficial kickoff of the Lake Placid holiday season!
Thank you to all who attended Joy to the Children on
December 12, 2024
! In-person for the first time in 5 years! Your support makes our mission possible ‚Äì presenting and fostering quality arts which inspire, enrich, educate and entertain people of all ages.
Supporting LPCA‚Äôs Arts Education Programs

Bringing the arts to the Adirondacks for over 50 years ‚Ä¶
Since 1972, the Lake Placid Center for the Arts (LPCA) has presented arts programming of the highest caliber amidst the stunning backdrop of the Adirondack Park of Northern New York.
Founded by Nettie Marie Jones, whose generosity and vision provided both the 4.5 acres and the buildings on which the LPCA grew, the LPCA works to fulfill its mission to inspire, enrich, educate and entertain people of all ages through four pillars of artistic programming, which constitutes a majority of the work we do each season.
Performance Series
A thrilling season of performances by theatre, music, dance, circus, and comedy artists in our intimate 350-seat theatre and at our outdoor summer Open Sky Music Festival.
See what is coming soon to an LPCA stage‚Ä¶
Arts Education
More than 50 in-person workshops and over 100 virtual classes in multiple performing and visual arts disciplines, offering an opportunity for all students to develop new skills, whether they are 4 or 104 years old.
Find a class to take your skills to the next level‚Ä¶
Visual Arts
13 rotating exhibits each year featuring the work of approximately 150 national and local artists at The Gallery @ LPCA, as well as work for sale at our Gallery 46 location on Main Street that represents over 100 professional artists annually who live or work in the Adirondacks.
Explore what is hanging in the galleries today‚Ä¶
Services to Artists & Arts Organizations
Dedicated administrative services to independent artists and to our fellow arts organizations which collectively help to create a strong and thriving arts community within the North Country. Potential grant opportunities for artists and organizations alike. Residencies for artists to take their work to the next level.  These new organizational focus works to grow the impact of arts and culture in the region and beyond.
Learn more about our work to support artists & organizations‚Ä¶
‚ÄúBeing a member of the arts center has been such a joy for me ‚Äì to come in pre-children, now watching [my kids] grow up here at the arts center and watching them learn so much‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt think that their  childhood would have been as rich without the arts center here. ‚Äù
‚Äî Brooks Reynolds

Supporting LPCA‚Äôs Arts Education Programs

Artists & Opportunities
The LPCA supports working artists in an array of disciplines from visual art to contemporary dance. By sharing opportunities for local gallery representation, professional development, funding and residency space, LPCA offers resources to help local artists create a lasting impact on the field and in our communities.
Gallery 46
Gallery 46 represents artists who live or create their work within the Adirondack Park of Northern New York. Applications are accepted year-round from local artists working in all mediums. Selected applicants join an ever-rotating collection featuring dozens of artists.
Visit Gallery 46
Artist Submissions
Artists of all mediums are invited to submit their work to LPCA‚Äôs two galleries, the Gallery @ LPCA and Gallery 46.
See Current Opportunities
Artist Residencies
The LPCA is committed to nurturing the artistic process. Multi-week creative residencies allow artists to work and create amidst the beauty and tranquility of the Adirondacks. Residencies have included dance companies (Keigwin + Company, EMERGE125), circus (Circumference, Acrobatic Conundrum) and visual artists (Betsy Stewart, Sarah Yeoman).
Link to Artist Residencies
